sources.title: Cloud Native Computing Foundation – State of Cloud Native Development 2024
sources.summary: Survey of global cloud native adoption trends highlighting how codified architecture practices support platform scale and sustainability targets.

sources.title: ThoughtWorks – Architecture as Code: The Next Evolution
sources.summary: Explains why Architecture as Code is the natural progression of infrastructure automation and outlines organisational shifts required for adoption.

sources.title: Martin, R. – Clean Architecture: A Craftsman's Guide to Software Structure
sources.summary: Classic text on architectural modularity that underpins the book's guidance on codifying structural decisions and responsibilities.

sources.title: Atlassian – Documentation as Code: Treating Docs as a First-Class Citizen
sources.summary: Outlines practices for version-controlled documentation, reinforcing the manuscript's emphasis on treating architectural artefacts as code.

sources.title: GitLab – Documentation as Code: Best Practices and Implementation
sources.summary: Details GitLab workflows for docs-as-code programmes that extend directly into Architecture as Code governance models.

sources.title: Ford, Neal et al. – Building Evolutionary Architectures
sources.summary: Explores fitness functions and architectural evolution strategies adopted within Architecture as Code delivery patterns.

sources.title: Brown, S. – C4 Model Overview
sources.summary: Defines the hierarchical C4 modelling approach used throughout the book's Structurizr examples and diagramming conventions.

sources.title: Structurizr – Structurizr DSL Language Reference
sources.summary: Reference for the Structurizr DSL syntax employed to keep architectural diagrams executable and version-controlled.

sources.title: Thoughtworks Technology Radar – Governance as Code
sources.summary: Describes how policy automation integrates with Architecture as Code, guiding governance patterns within regulated organisations.

sources.title: HashiCorp – Terraform Security Best Practices
sources.summary: Summarises secure Terraform operations and state management principles referenced in the security chapters.

sources.title: Microsoft Learn – Store Terraform state in Azure Storage
sources.summary: Provides state storage patterns that underpin the Azure-focused examples in the security and compliance chapters.

sources.title: Pulumi – Testing Infrastructure as Code Programs
sources.summary: Explains unit and integration testing strategies for infrastructure automation that inform the quality practices in Chapter 13.

sources.title: MarketsandMarkets – Infrastructure as Code Market Report
sources.summary: Quantifies the growth of the infrastructure-as-code market, supporting the business case for Architecture as Code investments.

sources.title: IDC – Worldwide DevOps Software Tools Forecast, 2023–2027
sources.summary: Forecasts DevOps tooling spend and adoption trends referenced when planning automation roadmaps for Architecture as Code.

sources.title: FINOS – CALM: Common Architecture Language Model
sources.summary: Describes the FINOS initiative aligning financial services architecture models, reinforcing cross-industry codification efforts.

sources.title: HashiCorp – State of Cloud Strategy Survey 2024
sources.summary: Highlights executive priorities, capability gaps, and cloud operating models that inform organisational change recommendations.
